p: The invasion of new parasites and their emergence to free areas is also seen in the aquatic ecosystem. In Canada, parasitological investigations of the Laurentian Great Lakes basin determined at least 182 non-indigenous invading parasite species, i.e. a new invader species emerges every 28Â weeks (Marcogliese 2008; Ricciardi 2006). The increase in seawater temperature-induced severe diseases to corals reefs which started to die. Coral reefs represent safe housing and food for several fish types. The increase in water temperature also leads to a decrease in the amounts of dissolved oxygen in the water. All these factors lead to great disturbance in the aqua ecosystem (Hakalahti et al. 2006; Harvell et al. 1999; Hayes et al. 2001).
